lead_paragraph: Honolulu responded to what the governor called a state of emergency, passing tough criminal laws aimed at ridding sidewalks, streets and parks of homeless people.

headline.print_headline: Aloha, and Welcome, Unless You’re Homeless
headline.main: Aloha and Welcome to Paradise. Unless You’re Homeless.

snippet: Honolulu responded to what the governor called a state of emergency, passing tough criminal laws aimed at ridding sidewalks, streets and parks of homeless people.
abstract: Honolulu has nearly rid city of homeless people in two years through aggressive enforcement of all applicable laws; is now illegal to sit or lie on sidewalks, and authorities often threaten offenders with tickets and jail time to prod them to either seek homeless shelter or treatment facility; similar crackdown is taking place in cities across nation as gentrification rises, pushing rents ever higher and increasing population of homeless in many states.
